debug.description: Run tests in debug mode. If debug is enabled, chrome and electron windows will be visible, and remote debugging will be enabled in chrome.

cover.description: Run tests in coverage mode. If cover is enabled, Certa will measure code coverage according via `nyc`.

testBundle.description: The path to a javascript file containing all mocha tests to be run.

instrumentedTestBundle.description: An instanbul-instrumented version of the `testBundle`. This will be used instead of `testBundle` when running with `cover` enabled.

backendInitModule.description:
The path to a JavaScript module containing backend initialization logic.
This module will be required in Certa's "main" process ***before*** initializing a test runner.
If the file's `module.exports` is a Promise, that Promise will also be awaited before running tests.

ports.description: Defines ports used by the chrome and electron test runners.

debugging.description: The port that will be used by the v8 inspector (in Certa's "main" process) to communicate with a debugger (when the `debug` option is enabled).

frontend.description: [Chrome Only] The port that will be used to serve test assets to the frontend.

frontendDebugging.description: [Chrome and Electron Only] The port that will be used for remote debugging (when debug is enabled).

timeout.description: The default test-case timeout, in milliseconds.

grep.description: Only run tests matching this regular expression

fgrep.description: Only run tests containing this string

reporter.description: Specifies the mocha reporter to use.

publicDirs.description: [Chrome Only] Directories that contain static assets which should be made available via the frontend webserver.
